heading: ebay down for count again
subheading: in problems similar to those last year, a critical server failure at ebay brings the world's most popular auction house down for several days.
author: wired news report
text: ebay computers failed on wednesday, thursday, and part of friday morning, effectively shutting down the world's most popular auction house. the company was still trying to resolve the problem early friday, according to an announcement message board. "the system disk is being rebuilt and data transferred from the backups," the company reported.trouble surfaced wednesday evening when an undisclosed technical problem brought the system down. that problem lasted until after midnight.a note to ebay users explained that there was no relation between the failure and the site's new design.although the site was back up by 10 p.m. thursday, ebay's server problems continued. the server remained down throughout the night and into friday morning.ebay had similar problems in 1998, when server shutdowns plagued the site for several days in november and december. the company has also been dogged by an ongoing federal investigation into traders exchanging illegal goods on the system.the company claims more than 1.5 billion page views per month, and currently has 2,258,649 items for sale. the site boasts more than 3.8 million registered users.
